metadata.title: Influenza A H5N1 and H7N9 in China: A spatial risk analysis

abstract.original_text: Zoonotic avian influenza poses a major risk to China, and other parts of the world. H5N1 has remained endemic in China and globally for nearly two decades, and in 2013, a novel zoonotic influenza A subtype H7N9 emerged in China. This study aimed to improve upon our current understanding of the spreading mechanisms of H7N9 and H5N1 by generating spatial risk profiles for each of the two virus subtypes across mainland China.

This study aimed to improve upon our current understanding of the spreading mechanisms of H7N9 and H5N1 by generating spatial risk profiles for each of the two virus subtypes across mainland China .

abstract.original_text: Citation: Bui CM, Gardner L, MacIntyre R, Sarkar S (2017) Influenza A H5N1 and H7N9 in China: A spatial risk analysis. PLoS ONE 12(4): e0174980.
